## Semantic HTML & Accessibility Checklist

- [ ] Used appropriate semantic HTML5 elements (e.g., `<header>`, `<nav>`, `<main>`, `<article>`, `<section>`, `<aside>`, `<footer>`)
- [ ] All images have descriptive `alt` attributes
- [ ] Proper heading hierarchy is maintained (h1 → h2 → h3, no skipping levels)
- [ ] Forms use proper `<label>` elements with `for` attributes
- [ ] Interactive elements are keyboard accessible
- [ ] ARIA attributes used only when necessary and correctly
- [ ] Links have descriptive text (avoid "click here")
- [ ] HTML validates without errors (W3C validator)

- [ ] Tested with keyboard navigation
- [ ] Tested with screen reader (if applicable)
